column1: # Use this sheet to define settings for Server profile connection to be created in OneView.
# If the row starts with '#' it will be ignored by the script
# DOES NOT apply to RACK Servers (DL)
# Name of ProfileTemplate that uses those connections
column3:
# The numeric identifier for this connection.  
# Connections are normally numbered sequentially from 1 within each profile
column4: # The Network (Ethernet or Fibre Channel) or Network Set resource Name to be used with this connection.
column5:
# Identifies the port (FlexNIC) used for this connection. 
# The port can be automatically selected by specifying 'Auto' when creating the connection.  
# 'None' is a valid portID for an unconfigured, and unmapped Connection. 
# G7 only:  For LOM ports, the valid portId prefix will be "Lom"
# Gen8 only:  For FlexLOMs, the valid portId prefix will be "Flb"
# Mezzanine adapter prefix is "Mezz"
column6:
# Requested bandwidth (in Mbps) to be used for this connection.
# Default: 2500
column7:
# Specify to configure bootable settings. 
# If omitted, then the connection is not bootable, and -priority is set to NotBootable.
# Yes / No
column8:
# Optional boot option for this connection, but Required if -bootable is specified.  
# Accepted values are:
# NotBootable 
# UseBIOS
# Primary or Secondary. 
# When the Connection Type is Ethernet, this affects PXE boot. 
# If the Connection Type is FibreChannel, this enables BfS settings.
column9:
# Use to specify user defined address values
# Yes / No
column10: # Requested MAC address of the connection
column11: # Requested WWNN address of the connection
column12: # Requested WWPN address of the connection

column1: ## Also defined connectons for Profile template if applied
